channel.title: Easy RSC help with removing ant
channel.description: Can someone please explain to me how to remove the requirement of apache ant for the client? Have tried for weeks without success:(

item.title: Easy RSC help with removing ant
item.dc:creator: @bengina bengina
item.description:
@bengina wrote:

[quote=“Snemo, post:10, topic:446963”][quote author=bengina link=topic=549864.msg4030438#msg4030438 date=1340716858]
Don’t be so fucking stupid…

I just downloaded your client and placed that in and… OH MY GOD IT WORKED???

Its calling the compiled mudclient class that is inside the rscd.jar that is created when you compile YOUR client…
[/quote]

u mad bro?[/quote]

Actually I wasn’t mad, I was simply amazed by your stupidity…

It seemed to me that by using a negative enforcement of vocabulary may in fact entice you to read what was being said, From the above comment I see that advice given to you is lost because of the low maturity level… Maybe the RS2 boards would be more to your liking? They tend to spoon feed the information which may be better for your obvious remedial intellect…

Read full topic
item.source: Easy RSC help with removing ant

Don’t be so fucking stupid…

I just downloaded your client and placed that in and… OH MY GOD IT WORKED???

Its calling the compiled mudclient class that is inside the rscd.jar that is created when you compile YOUR client…
[/quote]

u mad bro?[/quote]
Yes, he is, because you’re too retarded to be in this community. And that says a lot. We don’t reject many people.

[quote=“bengina, post:7, topic:446963”]Don’t be so fucking stupid…

I just downloaded your client and placed that in and… OH MY GOD IT WORKED???

Its calling the compiled mudclient class that is inside the rscd.jar that is created when you compile YOUR client…[/quote]

lol what are you talking about? this post has been resolved already

item.source: Easy RSC help with removing ant

item.title: Easy RSC help with removing ant
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

[code]@echo off
java -classpath rscd.jar;lib/xpp3.jar;lib/xstream.jar;lib/hex-string.jar;lib/jmf.jar org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient
pause

[code]

Change the RSCD.JAR to whatever your jar file is, if your .jar is also RSCD this will work.[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Easy RSC help with removing ant

item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

That loads Yong Min’s EASY RSC. I have my own version, how would i load MY version

Use what has been provided for you. It will work.
